item.item: Mixed
A mixed data type indicates that the referred property may take any data type.
String
A string data type indicates that the referred property may hold UNICODE characters, this type does not include binary data.
String
An integer data type indicates that the referred property may hold a 32 or 64 bit integral numeric value.
Float

A float data type indicates that the referred property may hold a floating point number, also known as double or real. The precision of such value is not inferred, in general it will be a 32 or 64 bit real.
Array

This data type defines a list of key/value pairs, the key will be in general a string, while the value type is not inferred. This data type usually applies to arrays in which the key part is the discriminant and determines the type of the value, while traditional arrays are better defined by a fixed sata type and a list data kind.
Structure
This data type defines a structure, this means that the value will be an object or an array of objects if the data kind is a list.
Language strings

This data type defines a list of strings expressed in different languages. The list elements are composed by two key/value pairs. The first pair has the tag corresponding to the :language persistent identifier as its key and the value represents the language code. The second pair has the tag corresponding to the :text persistent identifier as its key and the value represents the text expressed in the language defined in the first pair. No two elements may share the same language and only one element mat omit the language pair.
Enumeration

An enumerated data type indicates that the referred property may only hold a term reference, that is, the global identifier of a term object. Enumerated values are by default strings and must refer to a term.
Enumerated set

An enumerated set data type indicates that the referred property may only hold a list of term reference, that is, an array of term object global identifiers. All the elements of this list must be unique.
Term reference
A term reference is a string that must correspond to the native identifier of a Term object.
Tag reference
A tag reference is an integer that must correspond to the sequence number of a Tag object.
Node reference
A node reference is an integer that must correspond to the sequence number of a Node object.
List
This type indicates that the property is a list of values, each of the defined data type.
